doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Leading the Charge into the Electrification EraLeading the Charge into the Electrification Era_2025-08-31

passages.text: ASIA- PACIFIC excl. Japan | Machinery Sinotruk

We joined the NDR call hosted by Sinotruk following its release of in- line 1H results. Key takeaways: 1) 2025 HDT sales are expected to rise \(10\%\) YoY to c.1mn units. Over the next 2- 3 years, mgmt expects China's HDT market will remain at the scale of 1mn units. 2) The full- year ESOP target is achievable, with 1H rev/profit surpassing the halfway mark. 3) In 1H, battery swapping accounted for \(32.3\%\) of electric HDT sales, while plug- in charging made up \(67.7\%\) .

- Mgmt expects China's HDT sales to reach 1mn units in 2025, up c.10% YoY, and annual sales to stay above 1mn units over the next 2-3 years, on the back of: 1) the trade-in program has included China IV and LNG HDT sales within the scope of subsidy eligibility. As of end-July, there were still c.600k HDTs at China IV or below emission standards in the fleet. 2) With the continuous decline in battery costs, increased support from the government for EV initiatives, and innovative marketing models, such as battery banks and policy-based leasing, the electric HDT market has entered an accelerated growth phase. 3) During 2017-21, China's HDT sales exceeded 1mn units p.a. for five consecutive years. Assuming an average replacement cycle of 8-10 years, this implies steady annual demand for fleet renewal. 4) Although Sinotruk expects China's HDT export sales to decline slightly YoY in 2025, mgmt expects the momentum to pick up over the next few years, as there remains substantial market potential in regions such as Africa and Southeast Asia. Notably, Sinotruk still targets 150k units of export sales in 2025, implying a 12% YoY rise.

- In 1H, Sinotruk exported 3,745 light-duty trucks, marking a 73% YoY increase, mainly through leveraging the brand and network advantages of its overseas HDT business, and increased resource allocation to the light-duty truck segments. The company has optimized its product lineup across 18 key markets and 15 application scenarios.

Views on anti- involution measures. Mgmt mentioned that the industry's inventory pressure has been erased. Customers are becoming more rational, shifting focus from upfront purchase costs (which account for only \(\sim 7\%\) of total ownership cost) to full lifecycle cost. OEMs are also adopting more disciplined pricing strategies, with Sinotruk taking the lead in raising prices for electric HDTs at the beginning of the year.

In 1H, China's electric HDT sales reached nearly 80k units, up 186% YoY, with penetration reaching \(22.8\%\) . Meanwhile, electric light-duty truck sales doubled YoY to 75k units, with penetration reaching \(23.4\%\) . Mgmt indicated that NEV penetration of both HDTs and light trucks is expected to reach \(30\%\) in 2H25, with continued growth anticipated over the next 2- 3 years.

- Battery-swapping vs plug-in charging.1) Performance: Mgmt mentioned that battery-swapping offers rapid energy replenishment—typically within 5mins. This efficiency rivals that of diesel trucks and is well suited for short-turn operations in ports and mining zones. 2) Cost: Plug-in charging is overall more economical over time. Battery-swapping HDTs use a chassis-only model with battery leasing, reducing initial purchase costs but requiring ongoing rental payments. 3) Infrastructure: battery swap stations cost more than RMB3mn each and face grid and land constraints. China has 8mn charging piles vs c.2000 battery swap stations for HDTs, with charging piles offering lower costs, faster approvals, and broader coverage. In 1H, battery swapping accounted for

PT based on 9x 2025E earnings, a 3- year historical mean. Downside risks: 1) HDT sales below expectations; 3) lower infra investment. 3) overseas uncertainties
Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Sinotruk Hong Kong Ltd (3808 HK: HK\$22.68, BUY)

Notes: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
